content.p: Congress reaffirms the policy set forth in section 20102(g) of this title (relating to surveying near-Earth asteroids and comets).

section.heading: Requests for information
section.chapeau: The Administrator shall issue requests for information on—

paragraph.content: a low-cost space mission with the purpose of rendezvousing with, attaching a tracking device,1 and characterizing the Apophis asteroid; and
a medium-sized space mission with the purpose of detecting near-Earth objects equal to or greater than 140 meters in diameter.

section.heading: Developing policy and recommending responsible Federal agency
section.chapeau: Within 2 years after October 15, 2008, the Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy shall—

paragraph.content: develop a policy for notifying Federal agencies and relevant emergency response institutions of an impending near-Earth object threat, if near-term public safety is at risk; and

paragraph.chapeau: recommend a Federal agency or agencies to be responsible for—

subparagraph.content: protecting the United States from a near-Earth object that is expected to collide with Earth; and
implementing a deflection campaign, in consultation with international bodies, should one be necessary.

content.p: The Administrator shall maintain a planetary radar that is comparable to the capability provided through the Deep Space Network Goldstone facility of the Administration.
